School Nutrition

USDA extends free meals for all children this fall
On Monday, the U.S. Department of Agriculture extended the option for child nutrition program sponsors to operate the Summer Food Service Program and Seamless Summer Option through as late as Dec. 31, 2020, dependent on available funding. This allows schools to offer nutritious meals to all children, regardless of free and reduced price meal eligibility status, at no charge this fall.

For more information, visit the CDE School Nutrition webpage.

Dear Weld Re-8 Community,

With the cancellation of in-person learning across Colorado for the remainder of this school year combined with the continued requirements for Social Distancing due to COVID - 19, we established two options for our seniors at Fort Lupton High School for a graduation ceremony. A survey was sent this past weekend to each Senior with the options of a virtual ceremony or a “parade” ceremony. The overwhelming majority of our students want to participate in a parade followed by walking across the stage at the High School Stadium / Bob Felps Field at the culmination of the parade through Fort Lupton.
This parade will begin at 8:00 AM on Saturday, May 23, 2020. As the details are worked out this week, we will provide you with all the information. We are partnering with the City Of Fort Lupton to create a memorable graduation for our students.

Alan
